playlist.title: Stretching Your Dollars
playlist.creator: OETA
playlist.annotation: Oklahoma News Report Stretching Your Dollars Feature Category

track.title: Oklahoma News Report
track.ov:subtitle: Gasoline Prices
track.annotation: Americans are feeling the pain at the pump, as gas prices continue to rise. Mike Thornbrugh with the Quik Trip Corporation, joined us to talk about the impact of the rising cost of gasoline, and its impact on business and consumers.

track.title: Oklahoma News Report
track.ov:subtitle: Holiday Spending and Tracey Ryder Interview
track.annotation: Shoppers spent more on Christmas this year, and that means a good holiday shopping season for retailers. The National Retail Federation predicts holiday spending will top 450 billion dollars. Thatâ€™s an increase of more than 3% from last year. Tracey Ryder with Consumer Credit Counseling has some advice for those who chose to put much of that spending on credit cards.

track.title: Oklahoma News Report
track.ov:subtitle: Returning Gifts
track.annotation: The shopping season remains in full swing. Holiday sales are a big draw, gift cards are proving quite popular, and shoppers are lining up at customer service desks with returns and exchanges.

track.title: Oklahoma News Report
track.ov:subtitle: Gift Cards
track.annotation: Holiday gift cards have become very popular. In an effort to protect consumers, new rules governing the use of the cards are in effect this year. Randy Cloud is a certified public accountant, and he joined us to talk about the new guidelines.

track.title: Oklahoma News Report
track.ov:subtitle: Economic Forecast and Live Interview
track.annotation: The economic forecast for Oklahoma is improving. Experts from across the state met in Oklahoma City to discuss the financial future of our state.

track.title: Oklahoma News Report
track.ov:subtitle: Tulsa Auction House
track.annotation: A company in Tulsa is doing big business, thanks in large part to the real estate bust. Williams and Williams Auctions has sold a billion dollars worth of foreclosed property, including the Pontiac Silver Dome.

track.title: Oklahoma News Report
track.ov:subtitle: Cyber Monday
track.annotation: With the holiday shopping season underway, many Oklahomans logged onto the Internet to take advantage of the deals offered on "Cyber Monday." We look at the growing impact of shopping online.
